title: Watermelon Pudding
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: - ¾ to 1 cup (150 to 200 g) sugar, depending on the sweetness of the melon
- Fresh jasmine blossoms, bittersweet chocolate shavings, candied squash, or chopped pistachios, for garnish
directions: 1. Cut off and discard the rind from the watermelon. Coarsely chop the watermelon into chunks.2. In a blender, puree enough chopped watermelon to yield 6 cups (1.5 L) of puree.3. Strain the watermelon puree through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium saucepan.4. Whisk in the cornstarch and sugar and bring to a boil, whisking constantly to prevent lumps.5. When the mixture comes to a boil, cook for 1 minute, then remove from the heat.6. Pour the mixture into one large dish or small bowls or glasses. Let cool, then refrigerate until well chilled.7. Garnish as desired before serving.
